dialog.name: hello
dialog.message: Hmmm... You don't seem ready yet, {activator.name}. I am sorry, but unless you regain at least part of your memory, there's no reason for us to sail to Strakewood...

dialog.name: hello
dialog.message: Did you not hear me?! Be off!

dialog.name: hello
dialog.message: Excuse me, I'm currently quite busy conducting these experiments...

dialog.name: hello
dialog.message: Excuse me, I'm currently busy working on this decoction.

dialog.name: hello
dialog.message: Welcome, traveler!
As usual, I'm looking for wolf pets to tan into leather. If you happen to have any, I would be interested in purchasing them from you.

response.message: Excuse me, I need to head out of the town.

dialog.name: out
dialog.message: Huh? What for? Everything you need is in the town; no need to venture out into the wild! Now leave me be.

response.message: Brelend Lee sent me on a mission to the mines.

dialog.name: brelend
dialog.message: Did he now? I suppose he knows what he's doing then... Very well then. Take this key to open the gate. And... be careful in the mines, please. There's a reason we've surrounded the town with such high walls...

part.name: The Priest
part.info: You have reached Incuna, and have started the attempt to get back your lost memories. Sam Goodberry has suggested that you go speak to the local church priest, who may be able to help you.

dialog.name: hello
dialog.message: There you are! I didn't wake you up when we arrived in Incuna, because it seemed like you needed a good rest. You certainly did - you've been sleeping for quite a while now. I even had time to replace the cabin door down in the lower deck!
At any rate, we did it - we managed to reach Incuna. We should resupply and head to Strakewood at last - but don't worry, I'll handle that and anything else we may need.
However... there's still the question of what to do about your memory loss. Say, has it improved?

response.message: I feel I'm starting to remember...

dialog.name: remember
dialog.message: Well, at any rate, I think you should visit the local church priest. Brelend Lee is his name, if I remember correctly. You should be able to find directions to him easily, perhaps by asking around the local townsfolk. A map would come in handy, hmm... I know, go visit Gulliver in the dock house. He's an old friend of mine, he might have a spare map for you.
Ah, one last thing! Here, take the rest of our mushroom supplies - I'll get us something better. No offense, but I feel I wouldn't be able to stomach any more of those things...

dialog.name: hello
dialog.message: Ah, {activator.name}! You're back. How did it go with the priest, Brelend?

dialog.name: working
dialog.message: I see. Don't worry, we're not in a hurry... but unless you regain some of your memory, I don't see the need for us to sail for Strakewood yet.

response.message: I need help recovering my memories.

dialog.name: helprecover
dialog.message: Recovering your memories, you say? Hmm. That is quite difficult business indeed, and often near impossible.
Say, how did you come to lose your memories?

response.message: Last thing I remember is a terrible storm...

dialog.name: storm
dialog.message: Ah yes. We saw the storm raging on the horizon from here. It started around... hmm... yes, exactly seventeen days ago and it lasted for three nights straight! People say they saw a great number of blue-colored streaks of light in the skies then, but I believe it was just lightning...
Quite an unnatural sight, if you ask me... hmm...
{npc.name} mumbles something that gets lost in his beard...
At any rate. I need to know whether your loss of memory was caused by physical or mental injury. The former I can heal, the latter, well, might require some more... finesse.

response.message: Sam said I bumped my head in the storm...

dialog.name: bumped
dialog.message: Well, I can try casting a spell on you that can heal any injury of the flesh. It might help in your case, and it might not. Are you ready?

response.message: Sure, let's give it a shot.
Not yet, give me a moment...

dialog.name: heal
dialog.message: Let's try this then!
{npc.name} mutters an incantation, and you feel the powers of magic cruising through your body, repairing what was once broken...
Phew, that was one of a difficult spell! You know, it doesn't get any easier casting spells as you get older...
So, do you feel any better?

part.name: Healed Body...
part.info: You have visited the local priest, Brelend Lee, and agreed to let him try and heal you with a spell.

dialog.name: hello
dialog.message: Ah, {activator.name}! You're back. How did it go with the priest, Brelend?

dialog.name: working
dialog.message: I see. Don't worry, we're not in a hurry... but unless you regain some of your memory, I don't see the need for us to sail for Strakewood yet.

dialog.name: hello
dialog.message: Say, how do you feel now?

dialog.name: headhealed
dialog.message: Ah, I knew I still have my healing touch! But what about your memories, do you feel anything? Do you remember what happened before the storm?

dialog.name: nodifferent
dialog.message: Hm, that's unfortunate... but what about your memories, do you feel anything? Do you remember what happened before the storm?

dialog.name: noremember
dialog.message: Blast it!... Excuse me.

This is a serious case of mental injury... of what sort, I don't know. Your memories might have been erased by magic against your will, your mind might have been meddled with by some dark magic, or there might be something even more sinister at work here...
{npc.name} mumbles something about spirit tampering into his beard...
One thing is certain. Something - or someone - doesn't want you to remember your original purpose and intent.
I will ponder some methods of breaking this, this curse, if you will, and I will get back to you soon. I might need some help collecting ingredients and such...
For now, I think you should go speak to Sam. He might have something for you to do while I think about this...

response.message: I'll do that, thanks. See you for now.

part.name: ... Broken Spirit
part.info: Brelend Lee has tried to recover your memories, but he was only successful in healing the wounds of the flesh. He has suggested that you go speak to Sam Goodberry while he ponders what to do next...

dialog.name: hello
dialog.message: Ah, {activator.name}! You're back. How did it go with the priest, Brelend?

response.message: My head doesn't hurt anymore, but I still can't remember much at all.

dialog.name: remember
dialog.message: Hm... that's not good at all. However, I may have found something for you to try. It might help you.

dialog.name: whatis
dialog.message: First off, I spoke to some of my friends around here. They're willing to help, if you want to stop by them.

First is the smith, Ken Berger. He has agreed to let you choose a melee weapon of your choice. I'm afraid that shiny meteorite steel sword you had must have gone overboard back in the storm, I couldn't find it anywhere. His shop is just by the temple.

dialog.name: else
dialog.message: The local hunter, Tom Istrad, has also agreed to let you choose one of his ranged weapons, if you so wish. I remember you practising with that yew longbow back on the ship; perhaps you'd like something like that again. He has a shop by the western gate.

There's also the priest, John Aldman, who wanted to teach you some divine magic. Now, I heard rumours that you knew some magic already, so you might just have the knack for this sort of thing. You can find him in the temple's basement.

dialog.name: then
dialog.message: Well... once you're ready, I heard my old friend, Arvend Blessed, the local tavern owner, is in need of some assistance.
I would appreciate it if you could lend him a hand in the matter. Be warned though, Arvend can be a bit... eccentric at times.

response.message: Alright, I'll give it a shot.

dialog.name: alright
dialog.message: Thank you, I appreciate it! You should be able to see Arvend's tavern from here; it's the building just past the docks, near the temple.

part.name: Gearing Up
part.info: Sam has suggested that you go speak to the local smith, Ken Berger, in order to choose a melee weapon to use. []optional]

response.message: I was told you could help me gear up.

dialog.name: gearup
dialog.message: Ah, Sam Goodberry sent you, did he now?
Yes, I can certainly gear you up with some basic weapons... Hmm, sort of weapons do you prefer?

dialog.name: sword
dialog.message: Are you sure that you want a sword?

dialog.name: dagger
dialog.message: Are you sure that you want a dagger?

dialog.name: axe
dialog.message: Are you sure that you want an axe?

dialog.name: club
dialog.message: Are you sure that you want a club?

dialog.name: ::confirm_pre
dialog.message: Alright, here you go!

dialog.name: ::confirm_post
dialog.message: Come back to my shop if you need my services again!

part.name: The Arcane
part.info: Sam has suggested that you go speak to the local cleric, John Aldman, in order to learn some divine magic. []optional]

response.message: Excuse me, Sam said you could teach me some spells.

dialog.name: spells
dialog.message: Sam? Ah, Sam Goodberry! I see, so you're the new face around here.
Well, hm, I can indeed teach you the basics, I suppose. Some spells that might come in handy in the near future, yes yes.
I will teach you [b]cause light wounds[/b] and [b]minor healing[/b], what do you say?

dialog.name: yes
dialog.message: So be it!

object.message: Cause light wounds is an offensive divine spell that shoots a projectile of raw divine power in the direction of your choice.
Minor healing is divine spell that instantly restores lost hit points.

dialog.message: May these serve you well on your travels!

part.name: Shooting Practice
part.info: Sam has suggested that you go speak to the tanner, Tom Istrad, in order to choose a ranged weapon to use. []optional]

response.message: I was told you could teach me the basics of archery.

dialog.name: archery
dialog.message: Ah, so, Sam sent you, did he now? Yes. I suppose I could help you. First, tell me, what sort of a ranged weapon do you prefer?
In fact, I will let you take one of those basics weapons to practise with.

dialog.name: bow
dialog.message: Are you sure you want a bow?

dialog.name: crossbow
dialog.message: Are you sure you want a crossbow?

dialog.name: sling
dialog.message: Are you sure you want a sling?

dialog.name: ::confirm_pre
dialog.message: Alright, here you go!

dialog.name: ::confirm_post
dialog.message: During your instructions with {npc.name}, you feel a small part of your memories coming back to you...
And that's pretty much it! No, no need to thank me, really!
However, if you were to see any wolves... I would be willing to pay for their pelts!
If you need any further practise, feel free to try shooting the target dummies!

dialog.name: confirm_bow
dialog.message: Now, let me teach you how to handle that bow properly...

dialog.name: confirm_crossbow
dialog.message: Now, let me teach you how to handle that crossbow properly...

dialog.name: confirm_sling
dialog.message: Now, let me teach you how to handle that sling properly...

part.name: Helping Out
part.info: According to Sam, a local tavern owner, Arvend Blessed, is in need of some assistance.

part.name: Ant Trouble
part.info: Arvend Blessed, a tavern owner in Incuna, has asked you to help with his ant infestation problem.

dialog.name: hello
dialog.message: Have you spoken to Arvend Blessed yet?

dialog.name: working
dialog.message: Arvend seemed to be a bit on edge, I think the sooner you figure out what's troubling him the better.

dialog.name: hello
dialog.message: Have you spoken to Arvend Blessed yet?

response.message: Yes, his barn has an infestation problem.

dialog.name: yes
dialog.message: Ah, I've heard about that while you've been running around. It seems Angela Sawthrow, a local priestess and herbalist, has been working on the issue. I would suggest chatting her up if you want to know the details.

response.message: I heard you needed some help?

dialog.name: needhelp
dialog.message: Ah, you must be the traveler Sam mentioned.
Yes, I'm having some issues with an ant infestation in my barn! They're enormous, and there's so many of them all over my precious stock of provisions!
A week ago, one of the priestesses from the temple stopped by and said she would look into the matter, but I haven't heard from her since. Could you please check up on her?
There will be a monetary reward involved if you help in solving the issue!

dialog.name: sure
dialog.message: The priestesses name is Angela Sawthrow. She mostly specializes in alchemy and healing, you should be able to find her somewhere inside the temple.

dialog.name: hello
dialog.message: Thank you very much for solving the ant issue!

part.name: The Priestess
part.info: Arvend Blessed, the local tavern owner, has asked you to speak to the local priestess and alchemist, named Angela Sawthrow, about the ants problem.

response.message: Arvend mentioned you had been looking into the ant infestation issue...

dialog.name: infestation
dialog.message: Ah, is that what this is about?
Yes, I've been looking into the issue and I've come to the conclusion that there are two approaches that could solve it.

dialog.name: tellmore
dialog.message: Well, the most obvious one would be to slay their queen, and hope that the rest of the ants slowly die off, as they will be left with no way to reproduce. Who knows how long that will take, though.
The other method would be to "poison" their food supply with a calming tonic which would render them unaggressive, perhaps even friendly.

response.message: We shouldn't take any chances and slay the beast.
We should try to make friends with them.

dialog.name: tellslay
dialog.message: Who's the real beast, I wonder; a creature trying to survive and harming no one, or a person who wants to kill the creature that has caused no harm...

dialog.name: tellfriends
dialog.message: That's the spirit! Ehm, excuse me. Yes, that would be my preferred approach.

dialog.name: ::help
dialog.message: At any rate, I need to ask you a favor. I need to you to enter the barn and deal with the ants however you see fit.
Are you up for such a task?

dialog.name: sure
dialog.message: Splendid. Here, take the tonic, should you decide to spare the ants. Just find a food source, for example some hay or straw that has ants swarming around it and pour the tonic somewhere nearby. The vapors alone should have instantaneous effects.
I almost forgot. Arvend has given me this key to unlock the barn. I think you better take it, Arvend almost always locks the barn. You can access it from inside his tavern.

dialog.name: noway
dialog.message: Well, come back if you change your mind...

dialog.name: hello
dialog.message: Ah, you're back! Have you talked to the priestess yet?

dialog.name: notyet
dialog.message: Well hurry up then, it's not like the ants will go away on their own!

part.name: The Ants
part.info: Angela the priestess has asked you to deal with the ants however you see fit, within reason.

part.name: Report To Angela
part.info: Report how you resolved the ants issue to Angela.

dialog.name: hello
dialog.message: Welcome back, {activator.name}.

response.message: I have resolved the ants issue.

dialog.name: resolved
dialog.message: Have you now?
{npc.name} listens to your story.

and.message: So, you killed the queen. However, you also calmed the ants, preventing further aggression.
I admire people with courage and creative thinking. The ants are likely to recover, find a new queen and the balance should be right once again.
So, you just straight up killed the ant queen in cold blood.
So, you calmed the ants and then you killed their queen, angering them once more.
So, you calmed the ants and didn't kill the queen, preserving the balance. You have my thanks, kind {self.gender}.

dialog.name: ::reward
dialog.message: Please, take this as a gift from me.
dialog.action: sack = CreateObject("sack") try: sack.CreateTreasure("random_talisman", level=activator.level, flags=GT_ONLY_GOOD, a_chance=0) obj = sack.inv[0] obj.Remove() obj.f_identified = True self.add_objects(obj) finally: sack.Destroy()

and.message: You should report the good news to Arvend, I am sure he will be pleased that we managed to resolve this peacefully.
You recall that Arvend mentioned a reward for killing the queen...
You should report your progress to Sam...

dialog.name: ::killed
dialog.message: You have become a beast yourself; just like that tavern owner, Arvend.

and.message: {npc.name} takes her tonic back from you.

dialog.message: Begone!

and.message: You recall that Arvend mentioned a reward for killing the queen...
You should report your progress to Sam...

part.name: Report To Arvend
part.info: After telling Angela that the ants have been calmed, she has suggested that you report the good news to Arvend, the tavern owner.

dialog.name: calmed
dialog.message: What?! I wanted the ant queen dead! How do you know that they won't attack my provisions again!?!
{npc.name} grumbles angrily.
Take this and off with you, or I will set my dogs on you!
You should report your progress to Sam...

part.name: To Slay A Queen
part.info: Slay the ant queen under the Incuna Barn to stop the ant invasion. [b]OR[/b]

dialog.name: hello
dialog.message: Ah, you're back! Have you talked to the priestess yet?

dialog.name: head
dialog.message: Eww, how abominable! Thank you, you have saved my barn. Please, take these coins as your reward.

and.message: Oh, you calmed the ants as well! That's even better. You deserve an extra reward for such effort!
You should let Angela know that we dealt with the situation successfully.
You should let Angela know that we dealt with the situation successfully.
You should report your progress to Sam...

dialog.name: hello

response.message: Yes, she proposed to calm the ants.

dialog.message: Ah, you're back! Have you talked to the priestess yet?

dialog.name: proposed
dialog.message: WHAT!?! Calm them?! Preposterous!
They need to be eradicated. I told Angela to make a poison tonic, not a calming one!

and.message: There will be a hefty reward if you slay the queen, sire!
There will be a hefty reward if you slay the queen, lass!

part.name: Making Friends
part.info: Befriend the ants by dropping the calming tonic Angela gave you near some ants and a source of food (such as straw or hay).

part.name: Back To You, Sam
part.info: Solving Arvend's ants problem, you decide to report back to Sam.

dialog.name: hello
dialog.message: Ah, you're back! You've been gone for a while, I was starting to worry, but you seem safe and sound.
I presume that the infestation problem has been taken care of?

response.message: Yes, the ants shouldn't be a problem any longer.

dialog.name: yes
dialog.message: Excellent! While you were away, Brelend came looking for you. He said that you should go see him immediately when you return.

response.message: Thanks, I'll talk to him. See you soon.

part.name: The Solution?
part.info: Receiving the information that Brelend Lee has been looking for you, you decide to visit him at his church.

dialog.name: hello
dialog.message: Hurry up, Brelend seemed to be anxious to speak to you!

dialog.name: hello
dialog.message: Ah, very good {activator.name}, you're here. I've been anxious to talk to you.

dialog.name: learned
dialog.message: Yes indeed. While you were gone, I spent a long time perusing the temple's library and consulting my colleagues and friends.

In one of the books, I found a mention of an amazingly powerful artifact, that was supposed to have been excavated from the nearby crystal mines. However, the book doesn't mention if this was ever finished!

response.message: Tell me more about these mines.

dialog.name: mines
dialog.message: The old mines, just north of the town, past a wooden bridge...

Long ago, the site was found to be rich in crystal deposits and mining operations began immediately. Eventually, the miners came upon a crystal like no other. It was blue, glowing with a pale white light and sparkling like a diamond.

response.message: What did they do with the crystal?

dialog.name: crystal
dialog.message: That's the sad part of the story...

The miners tried many things to remove the crystal from the rock it was embedded in, but every plan failed. In desperation, they decided to plant some carefully placed explosives, hoping to shatter the rock surrounding the crystal.

The resulting blast is said to have been heard from all the way over in Brynknot on Strakewood Island! For some reason, the placed explosives were many times stronger than they would have been under normal circumstances...
After the dust from the explosion cleared, the crystal lay on the floor, free from the rock at last. However...

dialog.name: happened
dialog.message: {npc.name} sighs heavily.
The blast was so great, it opened a large gaping hole in the rock the crystal was embedded in. Hundreds of tiny little red dots appeared in the blackness of the hole, one by one...
Kobolds. Hundreds of them, they struck quickly and without hesitation, overwhelming the miners. Only a few escaped that day...
The mine has been abandoned ever since.

dialog.name: crystal2
dialog.message: No one really knows. Those who escaped the kobolds didn't even think about grabbing it with them; there was no time.
It is said that the kobolds took it for their own, which is very likely.
There are also stories of the kobold king fashioning himself a crown out of it! What a load of nonsense. The crystal is probably impossible to work using any normal means.
At any rate. The crystal could be the answer for us; it's obviously highly magical. It's the best shot we have for unlocking your memories...

dialog.name: recover
dialog.message: I know you will. You seem to be much more in control, so to speak, in comparison to when you first came to me. How strange...
Well, go on, {activator.name}. Go to the western gate of the town, and ask Rick Grizley for a key to open it. From there, look for a bridge to the north and then, for a cave in the old mines.
If you do find the crystal, make sure to use gloves or a piece of cloth to handle it, for it could be very dangerous...

response.message: I'll better head there right away. See you soon.

part.name: The Kobolds
part.info: Receiving information about a powerful magical crystal in the old mines, located to the north of the north of Incuna past a bridge, you decide to investigate. The western gate out of the town is locked, but Brelend Lee mentioned that Rick Grizley, a guard by gate, has a key to open it.

dialog.name: hello
dialog.message: So, have you spoken to Brelend yet?

response.message: Yes. He wanted me to go to the old mines.

dialog.name: yes
dialog.message: Hm, that's terribly dangerous. Make sure you're ready before you head out. But Brelend must know what he's doing...

response.message: Sorry, how do I get to the mines again?

dialog.name: mines
dialog.message: {npc.name} sighs.
Follow the road west from the church until you reach a gate; the guard will let you pass if you tell him I sent you.
From there, head north, past a bridge until you see a rocky formation. Find the entrance on the western side of the formation, and proceed forth with caution...
The tales speak of a kobold king, or a leader, taking the blue crystal for himself. Please, bring it back in one piece...

dialog.name: crystal
dialog.message: You did?! I didn't think it possible! Fascinating, simply fascinating.
Now we shall see... here, let me have a look.
You let Brelend inspect the ring thoroughly...
Strange... it almost feels alive, buzzing with energy! No time to waste. Why don't you try putting it on?

dialog.name: goes
dialog.message: You barely touch the crystal with your bare skin, and you feel a shock run through you.
What's this?! Can you sense it too?! A presence!
[b][o=#ab1010][font=fanwood][size=+4][i]{activator.name}[/i]... come... continue your journey... and your questions... shall be answered...[/size][/font][/o][/b]
Oh my! Did you hear that too?

part.name: The Presence
part.info: Touching the blue crystal with your bare skin, something spoke to you and to Brelend. Perhaps he knows what it was...

dialog.name: hello
dialog.message: So, have you spoken to Brelend yet?

response.message: Yes, and I heard something speak to me when I touched the crystal!

dialog.name: touched
dialog.message: What?! That's a bad sign. You should ask Brelend what it means...

dialog.name: hello
dialog.message: {activator.name}! Snap out of it! Did you hear that too?

dialog.name: whatwas
dialog.message: A dark presence. I have never in my entire life, felt anything so powerful and menacing. Its voice still echoes in my mind...
I wouldn't touch the crystal again if I were you, and I would get rid of it as soon as possible.

response.message: After all the trouble we went through for it?
It can't be all that bad.

dialog.name: trouble
dialog.message: Hm... well...
Tell me. Do you feel any different?

response.message: I feel like something has... clicked... into place.

dialog.name: bad
dialog.message: You don't know what you speak of. I insist, we must get rid of it.

response.message: After all the trouble we went through for it?

dialog.name: dizzy
dialog.message: I don't doubt that. What about your memory though?

response.message: I feel like something has... clicked... into place.

dialog.name: clicked
dialog.message: Hm... it is as I feared. There is some sort of a magical bond between you, the crystal, and whatever that... thing... that spoke to us, was.
It said something about continuing your journey... well, I see no harm in that. However, be careful, please. That thing... is dangerous.

response.message: Thank you for everything. I'll go talk to Sam.

dialog.name: talk
dialog.message: Good idea. Remember, stay vigilant. And, {activator.name}?
Best of luck to you.

part.name: The Journey
part.info: After discussing with Brelend, you decide to continue on your journey and head back to Sam.

dialog.name: hello
dialog.message: So, how are we feeling? Did you figure out anything with Brelend?

response.message: Yes. We summoned a... thing. It told me to continue my journey.

dialog.name: continue
dialog.message: A thing? That spoke to you? What on earth do you mean?

response.message: It was some sort of a presence. I'm not quite sure.
Whatever it was, we need to press on, captain.

dialog.name: presence
dialog.message: How queer! What are we to do about it?

response.message: We need to press on, captain.

dialog.name: presson
dialog.message: Aye... I can see that you're no longer the same person who lost their memory. You seem more... sure of yourself.
Very well then. Are you packed up and ready to go?
